result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Shaquan Logan

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE BRANCH 9 ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court to address Justice Point Violation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE BRANCH 9 upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pre-Trial Conference.  State requests adjourned Scheduling Conference as there may be additional charge and Amended Information filed. Defendant shall be produced for next hearing date
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail
Turnover to JUSTICE POINT Level 5 supervision. Maintain absolute sobriety and comply with drug and alcohol testing. Comply with all terms and conditions of bail in all other pending criminal cases.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 as the deadline for the State to turnover all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, to the defense. Court sets 08/08/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or change of plea forms. Defense has a bail motion that they had difficulties e-filing, motion given orally in Court. State objects to modification of bail. Court reduces cash bail to $500, conditions in bond entry. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan in court, appear by video with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn, appear by video.  Defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer M. Lazaris.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has appointed counsel.
 Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Marcus Shaquan Logan in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus Shaquan Logan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
